subject: Business
title: The Psychology of Spending
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Psychology of Spending.

hook.text: People spend 12-18% more when paying with credit cards vs. cash. Plastic removes the pain of payment.

buildup.text: Spending triggers dopamine â€” the same reward chemical as social media likes and sugar.

discovery.text: Retailers exploit this: 'limited time offers' create urgency, anchoring shows fake high prices, and subscriptions hide.

twist.text: The 24-hour rule works: wait a day before any purchase over $50. Most impulse desires fade within hours.

climax.text: Behavioral economist Dan Ariely found people value 'free' irrationally.

punchline.text: Your brain wants you to spend. Knowledge is the override button.

quiz.question: Why do people spend more with credit cards than cash?
options: Credit cards remove the psychological pain of payment
